messages.title: Get in touch with me
messages.content: Dear Resident, Families are the bedrock for everything else. I want York to be a great place to work, raise a family and live in retirement. I brought up my children in York. They went to Fulford schools. We use the NHS. I work to make York a better place for everyone...

messages.title: Off to a good start
messages.content: Children are our future. Labour has given working mums longer maternity leave and better maternity pay. Dads now get paternity leave and both have rights to flexible working hours and time off to care for sick or disabled children. Thousands of York families get cash help with their child care costs, and all children get free nursery education and money to start a trust fund in their own name.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for families including tax credits, support for children's centres, personal trust funds for children and education results among the best in Britain.

issues.education: Spending per pupil in York schools has more than doubled, and York's school exam results are among the best in Britain.
issues.socialWelfare: 6,070 York families receive tax credits worth, on average, £3,112 a year. York’s Children’s Centres support 8,400 children aged under five. 10,760 York children have personal trust funds funded by the government.

contactInformation.address: Hugh Bayley, 59 Holgate Road, York YO244AA

images.caption: Photo of Hugh Bayley with family.
